unnormalised: Rooftop solar subsidies in India are crucial for achieving our renewable energy goals. The current subsidy structure, while helpful, needs streamlining. Perhaps a tiered approach based on consumption, similar to the Maharashtra model, would be beneficial. Ensuring timely disbursement, maybe through direct benefit transfer (DBT) like for PM-KISAN, is also essential. Transparency is key; citizens from villages like Rampur should be easily able to track application status online. More awareness campaigns are needed, especially before festivals like Onam, so families consider solar before investing in new appliances for celebrations. The Rs. 10,000 crore allocated under the scheme needs efficient utilization for widespread adoption, reducing reliance on conventional power by 2030.
normalised: Rupees ten thousand crore allocated under the scheme needs efficient utilization for widespread adoption, reducing reliance on conventional power by two thousand and thirty.
